intro: Hieracium mattfeldianum subsp. poliophorum, commonly known as the Poliophore hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has basal and cauline leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
